byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg reported from Baltimore, and Jess Bidgood from Boston. Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JESS BIDGOOD

abstract: Michael Schatzow and Janice Bledsoe, lead prosecutors in case of Freddie Gray, say there was sufficient evidence for rational juror to convict police officers accused in Gray's death but that Baltimore Police Dept sabotaged investigation; prosecutors reject accusation that they rushed to bring charges; comments come day after state's attorney Marilyn J Mosby dropped final remaining charges in case.
lead_paragraph: A day after all charges against the officers still awaiting trial were dropped, the two lead prosecutors said the police failed to serve search warrants for officers’ cellphones.

headline.main: Prosecutors Say Baltimore Police Mishandled Freddie Gray Case
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors in Gray Case Say the Baltimore Police Undermined Them

snippet: A day after all charges against the officers still awaiting trial were dropped, the two lead prosecutors said the police failed to serve search warrants for officers’ cellphones....
